title: Mark Warner sees profits dive 80%
text:
Mark Warner sees profits dive 80% 10 August 2015 Save 
The boss of Mark Warner has blamed an 80% fall in pre-tax profits on the ongoing uncertainty in Greece. 
Speaking to The Mail on Sunday , managing director David Hopkins said for the year to October 31, 2014 the operator has reported making £106,000 on sales of £42.4million. 
And while he said trading conditions have been equally bad in the winter as the summer, one particular issue continues to dominate its fortunes. 
He said: “This year has been particularly challenging because of the uncertainty in Greece. 
“Despite this, trading has now recovered and we are experiencing good demand again. 
“While it’s not going to be a vintage summer, it shows good signs of finishing strongly. 
“Trading for 2016 looks positive and we hope the political situation in Greece will remain stable and allow the travel industry to play a part in its recovery.”
